bibl.title: Jeremiah Mangan v. John H. McGraw. Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p:
IN THE DISTRICT COURT, Of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding Terms at Seatte, for the County of King.
HABEAS CORPUS.
The People of the United States of America, to the Sheriff of King County Greeting: We command you, that you have the body of Jeremiah Mangan by you imprisoned and detained as it said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention, by whatsoever name said Jeremiah Mangan shall be called or charged, before the HON. C H Hanford Richard A. Jones Judge of the aforesaid Court at Four O'Clock P. M. of this day to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning him and the said Jeremiah Manxgan And have you then and there this writ.
WITNESS THE HON. C H Hanford Richard A. Jones Judge of and the seal therof this 27th day of May A. D. 1889. R. M. Hopkins Clerk. By Deputy Clerk.

E T No. 6867
In the District Court, Third Judicial District, Holding Terms at Seattle, W. T.
In the Matter of the Application of Jere Mangan For Writ of Habeas Corpus.
HABEAS CORPUS.
WRIT
Returned and filed this 27 day of May A. D. 1889 R. M. Hopkins Clerk. By Deputy Clerk.
